data.title: Alpha bar chart
data.statement:
Given a string [[line]], build a bar chart representing the count of each letter, with vertical bars composed of char [[c]]. The count of each letter will be represented vertically by the number of [[c]] (each char represents one unit). Count only letters, by alphabetic order.

Add the x axis composed of all uppercase letters in [[line]] following alphabetic order.

Example for this input:
`ABCC
*`
Output should be:
`  *
***
ABC`
because there are 1 A, 1 B, and 2 C

testCases.title: Sentence 1
testCases.testIn:
If I'm not back in 5 minutes, just wait longer.
x
testCases.testOut:
x
      x    x   x
      x    x   x
x  x  x   xxx xxx
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
ABCEFGIJKLMNORSTUW

testCases.title: Sentence 1 validator
testCases.testIn:
If I'm not back in 10 minutes, just wait longer ok?
x
testCases.testOut:
x
      x    x   x
      x    xx  x
x  x  x x xxx xxx
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
ABCEFGIJKLMNORSTUW

testCases.title: All letters
testCases.testIn:
The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog
*

testCases.title: All letters validator
testCases.testIn:
The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dogs
*

testCases.title: All letters 2
testCases.testIn:
Dans un wagon bleu, tout en mangeant cinq kiwis frais, vous jouez du xylophone
-

testCases.title: All letters 2 validator
testCases.testIn:
Dans un wagon bleu, tout en mangeant cinq kiwis frais, vous jouez du xylophone debout
-

testCases.title: Test 6
testCases.testIn:
Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
\

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testIn:
Coding isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.

testCases.title: Test 7
testCases.testIn:
In some ways, programming is like painting. You start with a blank canvas and certain basic raw materials. You use a combination of science, art, and craft to determine what to do with them.

testCases.title: Validator 7
testCases.testIn:
In some ways, programming is like painting. You start with a blank canvas and certain basic raw materials. You use a combination of science, art, and craft to determine what to do.
*

data.outputDescription: The bar chart of letter frequency as described in the statement.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a string line, build a bar chart representing the count of each letter, with vertical bars composed of char c. The count of each letter will be represented vertically by the number of c (each char represents one unit). Count only letters, by alphabetic order.

Add the x axis composed of all uppercase letters in line following alphabetic order.

Example for this input:
ABCC
*

Output should be:
  *
***
ABC

because there are 1 A, 1 B, and 2 C
Input
line: a text
c: a character
Output
The bar chart of letter frequency as described in the statement.
Constraints
|line| < 256 chars
|c| = 1 char
Example
Input
AABCC
*
Output
* *
***
ABC
